about: I am a software engineer with background in web and mobile development, now transitioning towards platform engineering as I'm always eager to learn and take on new challenges. I graduated from the University of Hertfordshire with BSc. Computer Science in 2020. In 2021, I joined Tata Consultancy Services where I worked as a web developer and then a mobile developer for multiple years before making transition to Backend/DevOps engineer. I recently joined a Cloud/DevOps engineering training program where I got exposure to various tools such as Docker, Terraform, Kubernetes, Ansible, AWS and Azure cloud platforms to manage infrastructure and optimize workflows. I completed the program successfully where I developed and managed  a real world project as a part of the training program and now I'm looking for opportunities to expand my skills and stay up to date with the latest technologies. I’m more on the introverted side, so I don’t always say much, but I appreciate good conversations and meaningful connections. Feel free to reach out!

experiences.description: Completed Cloud/DevOps deep-dives training program. Successfully produced a real world application (EV battery range distance calculation with displaying EV charging stations over Azure Maps SDK) overlooking GitHub Actions CI/CD pipeline to streamline code integration, test coverage and deployments. Managed and optimized test environments using Github Actions, automated scalable infrastructure provisioning with Terraform and Kubernetes and server configurations with Ansible. Integrated Azure Map SDK using Microsoft Intra ID, wrote the backend logic for fetching Azure auth token, fetch map isochrone data and EV charing stations across the UK map.

Contributed to a web platform, a community-driven knowledge-based forum for the Nepalese community specifically targeted for international Nepalese students studying in the UK. Designed and built UI components using TailwindCSS, Context API, and React Query. Discussed and collaborated solutions to deliver a dynamic forum where people can access and create knowledge on various topics (TypeScript, Next.js, TailwindCSS, AWS).

Implemented virtual card component in the account overview section. Improved account overview quicklinks personalisation by replacing static quicklinks with dynamic quicklinks driven by the Real Time Interaction Management (RTIM) API. Delivered a POC project by contributing to the implementation of the suggestive search feature and contributed to the incremental migration from Android View System to Jetpack Compose. Worked in an agile scrum environment, taking part in shaping and refinement sessions with PO, BA, and team members contributing to the agile process.

Completed TCS graduate training program focused on Java applications and test-driven development. Worked on TCS in-house help desk web application, a part of the larger and cross-functional TCS Ultimatix team. Refactored nearly 60 percent of the frontend codebase and made it modular and reusable using React.js, Redux, React/TanStack Query and CSS modules. Used Jest for test frontend code. Tested existing Spring Boot codebase with JUnit and Mockito.

Responsible for Android app development within a larger team for a healthcare solutions provider. Contributed in the migration of Java codebase to Kotlin migrating Android AysncTask with Kotlin Coroutines. Leveraged app performance by using Room for local data persistence and Retrofit for API calls. Followed MVVM architecture, leveraging the usage of Android ViewModel for implementing booking system. Used Google Firebase database service for real-time data synchronisation and followed the best practices for version control using Git and GitHub. Used JUnit4 and MockK for unit testing, JaCoco for static code coverage, and Postman for testing APIs.

hobbies: I enjoy playing guitar and occasionally write and record music.
I like running and it is how I maintain a regular fitness routine. I also like going for walks to relax and clear my mind.
